stimulusHtml: In an experiment, two microscopic conducting spheres are made from the same solid material and have the same diameter. One sphere has a net charge of +7e and the other has a net charge of -2e. The spheres are briefly brought into contact and are then separated. After the experiment, which of the following correctly describes the most likely charges of the spheres and provides valid evidence or reasoning to support the claim?
choicesHtml: +2.5e on each sphere. Electrons move from the negative sphere to the positive sphere so that the total net charge is divided evenly between the two spheres.
+2.5e on each sphere. Protons move from the positive sphere to the negative sphere so that the +5e total net charge is divided evenly between the two spheres.

+2e on one sphere and +3e on the other sphere. Electrons move from the negative sphere to the positive sphere so that the +5e total net charge is divided as evenly as possible between the two spheres.
+2e on one sphere and +3e on the other sphere. Protons move from the positive sphere to the negative sphere so that the +5e total net charge is divided as evenly as possible between the two spheres.
